Adoption of the Filioque

'And in the Holy Spirit, the Lord, the giver of life,
who proceeds from the Father and the Son,
who with the Father and the Son is adored and glorified.'

The original Nicene Creed, established at the First Council of Nicaea in 325AD, did not have the phrase 'and the Son' added to 'who proceeds from the Father'. This is referred to as the Filioque, and by the decree of Pope [Root.GetFirstName] it has been added to the creed used by Latin bishops, to underline the importance of the Son in the Trinity...and reoundingly rejected by the vast majority of Greek bishops, who are furious that the Pope did so without calling an ecumenical council. To most, this is yet another example of the growing division between Greek and Latin Christianity.
